Name: Lion
description: Lions are big, powerful cats with yellow-brown fur. Male lions have a large mane of fluffy hair around their head. They live in groups called prides and are known for their loud roars. Lions are strong animals and are often called the 'king of the jungle'.

Name: Elephant
description: Elephants are the largest land animals on Earth, known for their big, floppy ears, long trunks, and wrinkly skin. They have strong, pillar-like legs and a large head with a wide, flat back. Elephants come in two main types: African and Asian, with African elephants being larger and having bigger ears.

Name: Tiger
description: A tiger is a big cat with orange fur and black stripes!,The tiger is the largest wild cat in the world They are very strong and good at hunting, and they are also excellent swimmers, according to Britannica Kids. Tigers are found in parts of Russia, China, and South and Southeast Asia.

Name: Giraffe
description: Giraffes are the tallest animals on land! They have long necks and legs, spots all over their bodies, and a coat that can be light brown or beige with darker spots. They live in Africa and are known for being friendly and peaceful. They use their long necks to eat leaves from tall trees.

Name: Cow
description: A cow is a gentle, four-legged animal that lives on farms and gives us milk! They have horns, a long tail, and can be black, white, or brown. Cows love to eat grass and are sometimes seen in groups called herds. They make a 'moo' sound and are very helpful animals, providing milk for us to drink and also helping farmers with work.

Name: Zebra
description: Zebras are wild horses with black and white stripes that live in Africa. They have unique stripe patterns, much like fingerprints, and are social animals who live in groups called herds. Zebras are herbivores, primarily eating grass, and can sleep standing up.

Name: Bear
description: Bears are big, furry animals with thick fur and strong claws. They come in different colors, like black, brown, and even white like the polar bear. They have short tails and a long nose. Bears live all over the world, from North America and South America to Europe and Asia. Some are good climbers, swimmers, and even enjoy eating plants and berries.

Name: Camel
description: Camels are amazing desert animals, sometimes called 'the ship of the desert,' because they are built to live in hot, dry places. They have humps on their backs, which store fat for energy, not water. Camels have two types: dromedaries with one hump and Bactrian camels with two humps.

Name: Donkey
description: A donkey is like a smaller, sturdy version of a horse, with really long, floppy ears! They have a short, upright mane and a tail that's more like a cow's, with long hairs only at the tip. Donkeys are known for their strong, sure-footed nature, which helps them carry heavy things, even over bumpy paths.

Name: Rabbit
description: Rabbits are adorable, small, fluffy mammals known for their long ears, short tails, and big eyes. They are gentle creatures that love to hop, nibble on plants, and curl up for a nap. Rabbits are social animals and often live in groups.

Name: Dog
description: Dogs are furry, four-legged animals known for being loyal and playful companions. They come in many different sizes, shapes, and colors, and they make great pets! Dogs are descendants of wolves and are a popular choice for family pets worldwide.

Name: Deer
description: A deer is a kind and quiet animal that lives in forests, meadows, and sometimes near farms. Deer have long legs that help them run fast and jump high. They have big ears to hear sounds and a little tail that wiggles when they run.Fawns usually have white spots on their backs!Deer eat plants like grass, leaves, and fruit. They are shy and like to stay away from people, but they are very beautiful animals.

Name: Squirrel
description: Squirrels are small, furry rodents with bushy tails, known for their acrobatic climbing and love of nuts. They come in many different colors and sizes, with some even being able to glide between trees. Squirrels are found all over the world, except for a few places like Australia and Antarctica.

Name: Pig
description: A pig is a smart and playful animal that lives on farms. Pigs have round bodies, short legs, and a curly little tail. They have a flat nose called a snout, which they use to sniff and dig in the ground.Pigs make funny sounds like 'oink, oink!' They eat fruits, vegetables, and grains. Baby pigs are called piglets, and they are super cute!

Name: Horse
description: Horses are big, strong animals known for their speed and endurance, making them great for riding and pulling heavy loads. They're herbivores, meaning they eat plants like grass and hay. Horses have a coat of fur, a long mane and tail, and strong legs with hooves. They're social animals and often live in groups called herds.

Name: Cheetah
description: Cheetahs are the fastest land animals on Earth, with their bodies built for speed and a coat of beautiful black spots. They are large cats with long legs, a slender body, and a long tail, all perfectly suited for reaching incredible speeds during hunts.

Name: Goat
description: Goats are furry animals that love to eat plants. They have horns, a short tail, and can be found in many colors! They are herbivores, meaning they eat things like grass and hay. Some goats live on farms and are kept for their milk and meat.

Name: Panther
description: Panthers are big, strong cats! They come in two main types: black panthers (leopards or jaguars with black fur) and mountain lions, also known as pumas or cougars. All panthers have sharp claws, powerful jaws, and can climb trees, making them excellent hunters.

Name: Leopard
description: Leopards are beautiful spotted cats that are skilled hunters and climbers, often found in various parts of Africa and Asia. They are known for their unique rosette spots, their ability to drag their prey up trees for safety, and their solitary lifestyles. Leopards are powerful, fast runners, and excellent swimmers, making them well-adapted to their diverse habitats

Name: Polar Bear
description: A polar bear is a big, strong bear that lives in the cold Arctic, where there’s lots of snow and ice. Polar bears have thick white fur that helps them stay warm and blend in with the snow.Polar bears have black skin under their fur to soak up the sun’s warmth. Baby polar bears are called cubs, and they stay close to their moms to learn and stay safe.

Name: Pigeon
description: A pigeon is a small bird that you can see in cities, parks, and even your backyard! Pigeons have soft feathers, small heads, and short legs. Most pigeons are gray with shiny feathers on their necks that can look green or purple in the sunlight.Pigeons can fly really well and flap their wings fast. They use their strong wings to travel long distances. They eat seeds, crumbs, and sometimes fruits.

Name: Dolphin
description: A dolphin is a smart and friendly animal that lives in the ocean. Dolphins look like fish, but they are actually mammals—just like people! That means they breathe air and have babies.Dolphins have smooth, gray skin, a long nose called a snout, and a curved mouth that makes them look like they are always smiling! They have fins to help them swim and a tail that moves up and down in the water.

Name: Eagle
description: An eagle is a big and powerful bird that can fly very high in the sky. Eagles have sharp eyes, strong wings, and big claws called talons. They use their sharp beaks and talons to catch their food, like fish, mice, and other small animals.Eagles are known for their amazing eyesight—they can see things far away, even from way up in the sky! They build big nests called aeries high in tall trees or on cliffs.

Name: Ostrich
description: An ostrich is the biggest bird in the world! It has a long neck, long legs, and big round eyes. Even though it’s a bird, the ostrich can’t fly—but it can run super fast!Ostriches live in dry, grassy places like deserts and savannas. They have fluffy feathers and strong legs that help them run away from danger. An ostrich can run as fast as a car on a city street!

Name: Arctic Fox
description: An Arctic fox is a small, fluffy animal that lives in the cold, snowy Arctic. It has thick white fur in winter to keep it warm and help it blend in with the snow. In the summer, its fur turns brown or gray to match the rocks and plants!Arctic foxes have small ears and bushy tails to help them stay warm. They are very good at sneaking and listening for tiny sounds under the snow, like mice or birds.

Name: Beaver
description: A beaver is a furry animal that lives near rivers, lakes, and streams. It has a big, flat tail, strong teeth, and loves to build things—just like an engineer!Beavers are amazing builders. They chew on trees with their sharp front teeth to build homes called lodges and walls called dams that stop water from flowing too fast.

Name: Badger
description: Badgers are cool, furry animals! They're like a cross between a weasel and a bear, but with a special look. They have short, strong bodies, short legs, and a white stripe from their nose to their shoulders. Badgers are famous for their digging skills, using their strong paws and claws to dig burrows and find food.

Name: Hamster
description: A hamster is a tiny, furry animal that many people keep as a pet. Hamsters have chubby cheeks, short legs, and tiny ears. They come in lots of colors like brown, white, gray, or golden.Hamsters live in cages with cozy bedding, tunnels, and toys. They like to eat seeds, fruits, and special hamster food.

Name: Hawk
description: Hawks are birds of prey, which means they hunt and eat other animals. They have sharp claws and beaks for catching and killing their food, and they can see things from far away. Hawks come in different sizes and colors, and they have long tails and short, rounded wings that help them fly fast and low.

Name: Jaguar
description: Jaguars are big cats with beautiful fur! They're known for their tan or orange coats covered in round, black spots called rosettes. These amazing animals are the largest cats in the Americas, and they love to swim. They're powerful hunters, sometimes climbing trees to ambush their prey.

Name: Rhinoceros
description: A rhinoceros, or rhino for short, is a huge animal with thick skin and one or two big horns on its nose. Rhinos live in Africa and Asia, and they like grassy places, forests, and muddy waterholes.Rhinos eat grass, leaves, and plants. They have big ears to help them hear, but their eyesight isn’t very good. Baby rhinos are called calves and stay close to their mothers.

Name: Wombat
description: A wombat is a short, chubby animal that lives in Australia. Wombats have thick brown or gray fur, short legs, and a big round nose. They look a little like small bears, but they’re actually marsupials, like kangaroos!Wombats are really good diggers. They use their strong claws to dig tunnels and burrows underground where they sleep during the day. They come out at night to eat grass, roots, and plants.

Name: Sheep
description: A sheep is a gentle farm animal covered in thick, fluffy wool. Sheep are usually white, but they can also be black, brown, or spotted. They have four legs, a short tail, and some have curly horns.Sheep live in groups called flocks and love to eat grass and hay. Farmers take care of sheep and shear their wool, which can be used to make clothes, blankets, and socks.

Name: Sloth
description: Sloths are slow-moving mammals that live in the trees of Central and South America. They are known for their incredibly slow movements and spend most of their lives hanging upside down. They have long limbs, curved claws for gripping branches, and shaggy fur that is often greenish due to algae growing on it.

Name: Racoon
description: Raccoons are furry animals with a distinctive black 'mask' around their eyes and a ringed tail. They are known for their clever paws and love of food, eating both plants and animals. Raccoons are nocturnal, meaning they are most active at night, and they are often found in wooded areas and even cities.

Name: Lynx
description: Lynx are wild cats with distinctive features like tufted ears and short tails, known for their thick fur and large paws. They are found in the forests of North America, Europe, and Asia, and are carnivores, primarily eating rabbits and other small animals.

Name: Lemur
description: Lemurs are furry, monkey-like primates with big eyes and long tails, found only on the island of Madagascar. They are known for being social, living in groups called troops, and communicating through sounds and tail movements. Lemurs are generally small, with some species resembling mice or foxes. They are known for their long tails, which they use for balance and communication.

Name: Turtle
description: Turtles are reptiles with a hard, bony shell that protects their body. They have short legs and claws, and many can pull their head, legs, and tail inside the shell for safety. Turtles are found all over the world, in water and on land.

Name: Porcupine
description: Porcupines are rodents known for their sharp, barbed quills that cover their back, sides, and tail. These quills are actually modified hairs that help protect them from predators. They are medium-sized animals, with a stocky build and short legs, and are generally slow-moving. Porcupines are also known for their nocturnal habits and for being solitary creatures.

Name: Albatrors
description: Albatrosses are big seabirds with huge wingspans, making them amazing gliders over the ocean. They spend most of their lives flying and can travel long distances without needing to land much. They have a long, hooked beak and webbed feet.

Name: Frog
description: Frogs are small, smooth-skinned animals that are amphibians, meaning they live both in water and on land. They have long, powerful legs for jumping and swimming, and they lack tails as adults. Frogs are known for their ability to croak and for their bulging eyes which help them see in many directions.

Name: Flying Squirrel
description: Flying squirrels are small, nocturnal rodents with a special flap of skin between their legs that lets them glide through the air, sort of like a tiny parachute. They don't actually fly like birds, but they're amazing at gliding from tree to tree.

Name: Jackal
description: Jackals are clever, dog-like animals, smaller than wolves but bigger than foxes, known for living in groups or pairs. They are active at dawn, dusk, and night, and can be found in Africa, Europe, and Asia. Jackals are omnivores, eating both meat and plants, and are known for scavenging and hunting small animals.

Name: Goose
description: Geese are large, plump birds with long necks and webbed feet, making them great swimmers. They are known for their loud honking calls and are often seen flying in a V-formation. Geese eat plants like grass and grains, and some also eat insects and fish. They are closely related to ducks and swans.

Name: Gorilla
description: Gorilla - Animal Facts for Kids - Monkey Species, Size, WeightGorillas are the largest of the ape family and are known for their impressive size and strength. They are generally peaceful, but the silverback male will fiercely protect his family group. Gorillas live in the forests of central Africa and are social animals that live in family groups called troops.

Name: Orangutan
description: Orangutans have short, thick bodies with shaggy red or orange hair. They have long, powerful arms and short legs. Adult male orangutans are about twice the size of the females. The adult males are almost 4.5 feet (1.4 meters) tall.

Name: Cobra
description: Cobras are venomous snakes known for their hooded posture when threatened. They live in warm places like Africa and Asia and eat other animals like rodents and birds. Some cobras can even spit venom from their fangs!

Name: Chihuahua
description: Chihuahuas are the smallest dog breed in the world, known for their big personalities, alert nature, and small size. They have rounded heads, big ears, and come in both smooth and long-haired varieties. Despite their small size, they are known to be brave and make good watchdogs.

Name: Koala
description: Koalas are small, furry animals with a gray or brownish coat, big fluffy ears, and a large black nose. They are marsupials, meaning they have a pouch where they raise their young, called joeys. Koalas are known for spending most of their time in eucalyptus trees, munching on leaves.

Name: Chinchillas
description: A rodent native to South America, the chinchilla is highly prized for its beautiful fur. The animal is about 14 inches (36 centimeters) long, not counting the bushy tail. Its bluish-gray fur is silky and extremely fine and is thicker than that of any other mammal.

Name: Hedgehog
description: Hedgehogs are small, nocturnal mammals known for their prickly spines. They have sharp spines all over their back, which they use to protect themselves by curling into a ball when threatened. They are relatively small, with a body length between 5 and 12 inches, and have a long snout used for foraging. Hedgehogs are often seen as gardeners' friends because they eat insects and slugs that can harm plants.

Name: Bison
description: Bison, also known as buffalo, are big, shaggy animals with a distinctive hump on their shoulders. They are the largest land mammals in North America and have a thick, brown coat that helps them stay warm in the winter.

Name: Meerkat
description: Meerkats are small, social mammals known for their distinctive appearance and behavior. They have slender bodies, a pointed face, and large eyes with dark patches around them, which help reduce glare in their desert habitat. Meerkats live in groups called mobs or gangs and are famous for standing on their hind legs to keep watch for predators.

Name: Owl
description: Owls are fascinating birds known for their round heads, flat faces, and large, forward-facing eyes. They are nocturnal hunters, meaning they are most active at night. Owls have sharp talons (claws) and hooked beaks, and many have soft feathers that help them blend into their surroundings. They are also known for their excellent eyesight and hearing, which are important for hunting.

Name: Mole
description: Moles are small, furry mammals that spend most of their lives living underground in tunnels they dig. They have đặc biệt features like powerful, shovel-like paws for digging, and velvety fur that helps them move through the soil. Moles are often seen as pests, but they also play a role in aerating and improving soil drainage.

Name: Monitor Lizard
description: Monitor lizards are big, strong reptiles with long bodies, powerful legs, and long tails. They are known for their long necks, forked tongues, and sharp claws. Monitor lizards are also very smart and can be found in many parts of the world, like Africa, Asia, and Australia.

Name: Chimpanzee
description: Chimpanzees are large, intelligent primates covered in dark hair, with long arms and flat faces. They live in groups in African forests and woodlands, and are known for their tool use and social behavior. They are also one of humans' closest living relatives.

Name: Rat
description: Rats are small mammals with long tails and pointed noses. They are known for their adaptability, often living near humans. Rats are generally larger than mice and have a variety of fur colors, including brown, black, gray, and white. They are rodents, meaning they have strong front teeth for gnawing.

Name: Cat
description: Cats are small, furry animals that are popular pets known for their playful and curious nature. They have sharp claws and teeth, soft paws, and a keen sense of hearing and smell, making them great hunters. Cats are also known for their independence, but they enjoy spending time with their families and are affectionate creatures.

Name: Antelope
description: Antelopes are graceful, fast-running mammals with long, slender legs and permanent horns. They are known for their speed and agility, using these traits to escape predators. Most antelope species live in Africa and Eurasia, inhabiting various environments like plains, grasslands, deserts, and mountains.

Name: Hare
description: Hares are mammals related to rabbits, known for their long ears, long legs, and swift speed. They are larger than rabbits and live mostly alone or in pairs, rather than in groups like some rabbits. Hares are herbivores, eating plants like grasses and leaves, and are active mostly at night.

Name: Crow
description: Crows are large, black birds known for their intelligence and loud 'caw' sound. They have shiny black feathers, a strong beak, and a fan-shaped tail. Crows are often found in groups and are famous for their cleverness and problem-solving abilities.

Name: Ants
description: Ants are small, social insects that live in colonies, also called nests or formicaries, with different jobs for different ants. They are known for their teamwork, strength, and ability to carry objects much heavier than themselves. Ants are found all over the world, except Antarctica, and play important roles in the environment.

Name: Hammerhead shark
description: Hammerhead sharks are known for their unusual, hammer-shaped heads. They have a wide, flattened head that extends out on either side of their body, with an eye and nostril at each end. Hammerheads are found in warm, tropical waters around the world and are skilled swimmers.

Name: Chameleon
description: Chameleons are unique lizards known for their ability to change color, long sticky tongues, and independently moving eyes. They use these features to camouflage, hunt, and communicate. Most chameleons live in trees and have a prehensile tail for gripping branches.

Name: Caracal
description: Caracals (pronounced CARE-uh-kals) are small wild cats with long, strong legs, brownish-red fur and long, black tassles of fur sticking up from the tops of their pointy ears. Their bellies are white with spots and they can be as long as about 36 inches from the tip of their nose to the tip of their tail.

Name: Kangaroo
description: Kangaroos are large, hopping marsupials native to Australia and New Guinea. They are known for their powerful legs, long tails, and pouches where they carry their young. Kangaroos are herbivores, meaning they eat plants, and they can hop long distances, reaching speeds up to 30 miles per hour

Name: Dodo
description: The dodo bird was a large, flightless bird that lived on the island of Mauritius. It was known for its gray feathers, a large hooked beak, and small, useless wings. Dodos were about three feet tall and weighed between 22 and 40 pounds. They became extinct in the 17th century, mainly due to human activities and the animals they brought with them.

Name: Bull
description: A bull is a male cow, known for being strong and muscular, especially in the neck and head. Bulls have horns and are used for breeding and sometimes in sports like rodeo. They can be identified by their large size, powerful build, and horns.

Name: Mouse
description: Mice are small, furry rodents known for their pointed noses, large ears, and long tails. They are active at night and enjoy exploring and eating a variety of foods. Mice are known for their high breeding rate and can be found all over the world.

Name: Vulture
description: Vultures are large birds that are nature's cleanup crew! They are known for eating the bodies of dead animals, called carrion, which helps keep the environment clean and healthy. Unlike other birds of prey, vultures rarely hunt for live animals, preferring to scavenge. They have special adaptations, like bald heads and strong stomach acids, that help them eat carrion safely.

Name: Duck
description: Ducks are small, swimming birds with short necks and legs. They have webbed feet for swimming and broad, flat bills for finding food in the water. Ducks live near water like ponds, lakes, and rivers. Male and female ducks often look different, with males often having brighter colors to attract a mate.

Name: Elk
description: Elk are large, deer-like animals with impressive antlers on the males, called bulls. They are social animals that live in herds and are known for their keen senses, especially hearing and vision. Elk are herbivores, eating plants like grass and leaves, and are excellent swimmers and runners.

Name: Baboon
description: Baboons are large, ground-dwelling monkeys with dog-like faces, strong limbs, and long tails. They are known for their intelligence, loud vocalizations, and sometimes aggressive behavior. Baboons live in Africa and Arabia, in various habitats like savannas and woodlands.

Name: Marten
description: Martens are small, furry animals that belong to the weasel family. They have long, slender bodies, bushy tails, and short legs. Martens are known for their climbing skills and are often found in forests where they hunt for food like rodents and birds. They have soft, brown fur, and some have a distinctive orange or creamy white throat patch.

Name: Moose
description: Moose are big, gentle giants from the deer family, known for their long legs, large antlers (on males), and big snouts. They live in cold, northern forests and are excellent swimmers. Moose are herbivores, meaning they only eat plants, and they're well-adapted to their snowy environments.

Name: Crocodile
description: Crocodiles are large, reptile predators with tough skin, powerful jaws, and sharp teeth. They live in and around water, often found in tropical regions of Africa, Asia, the Americas, and Australia. These animals have a long snout, and their eyes are on top of their head, which helps them see while mostly submerged.

Name: Hen
description: A hen is a female chicken. She's known for laying eggs, which can hatch into baby chicks. Hens are typically found on farms and are raised for their eggs and meat. They have feathers, wings, and a beak, and they make a 'clucking' sound.

Name: Walrus
description: Walruses are large, marine mammals known for their long tusks and whiskers. They live in the icy Arctic waters and are social animals, often found in large groups called herds. They are carnivores, primarily eating clams and other shellfish, and use their sensitive whiskers to find food on the ocean floor.

Name: Fox
description: Foxes are small, dog-like mammals known for their pointed ears, bushy tails, and reddish-brown fur, especially the red fox. They are found in many places, including forests, mountains, and even cities. Foxes are omnivores, meaning they eat both plants and animals, and are known for their cleverness and adaptability.

Name: Armadillo
description: Armadillos are small mammals known for their unique, bony shell that covers their head, back, legs, and tail. They are the only animals with this type of armor. The word 'armadillo' means 'little armored one' in Spanish. They live in the Americas, and some species live in the southern United States.

Name: Wolf
description: Wolves are large, wild animals related to dogs, known for living and hunting in groups called packs. They are carnivores, meaning they eat meat, and are found in various habitats like forests, grasslands, and mountains. Wolves have sharp teeth, strong bodies, and thick fur that can be gray, black, or white.

Name: Monkey
description: Monkeys are clever, social animals that are known for living in groups and swinging through trees. They are primates, meaning they are mammals with hair, are warm-blooded, and give birth to live young. Monkeys have long limbs and often have long tails, which can be used for grasping branches. They are known for their intelligence and ability to use their hands and fingers to hold and manipulate objects.

Name: Bat
description: Bats are unique, flying mammals with a body covered in fur. They are the only mammals capable of true flight. Bats have large ears, short snouts, and come in various colors like black, brown, red, tan, and gray. They are nocturnal, meaning they sleep during the day and are active at night. Bats use echolocation to navigate and find food, especially in the dark.

Name: Giant Panda
description: Giant pandas are black and white bears known for their distinctive fur pattern and love of bamboo. They live in the bamboo forests of central China and spend most of their time on the ground, though they can climb trees. They have a bulky body, a round face, and a thick, woolly coat that keeps them warm.

Name: Camel
description: Camels are large mammals known for their humps and ability to survive in desert environments. They have long necks, long legs, and large feet adapted for walking on sand. Camels can be found with either one or two humps, which store fat that they can use for energy when food is scarce.

Name: Hippopotamus
description: Hippos, also known as hippopotamuses, are large, semi-aquatic mammals native to Africa. They are known for their big, barrel-shaped bodies, short legs, and enormous heads. Hippos spend much of their time in the water, often in rivers, lakes, and swamps, to stay cool in the hot African climate. They are herbivores, primarily eating grass, and can hold their breath for up to five minutes while swimming.

Name: Ibex
description: Ibexes are mountain goats with impressive, curved horns, especially the males. They live in rocky, high-altitude areas and are known for their strong legs and ability to climb and jump on steep terrain.

Name: Possum
description: A possum is a small, furry animal that usually comes out at night. It has a long tail, big eyes, and a cute pink nose! Possums are great climbers and love to live in trees. They eat all sorts of things—fruits, bugs, and even leftovers they find. One of the coolest things about possums is that when they get scared, they might 'play dead' to trick other animals into leaving them alone. This is called 'playing possum'!

Name: Buffalo
description: Buffaloes are large, powerful animals with thick fur, big horns, and a sturdy build. They are known for their strength and are often found in herds, grazing on grasslands. There are different types of buffalo, like the African buffalo and the Asian water buffalo, each with unique characteristics.

Name: Otter
description: Otters are playful, semi-aquatic mammals known for their sleek bodies, webbed feet, and thick fur that keeps them warm in the water. They belong to the weasel family and are skilled swimmers and divers, often found near rivers, lakes, and oceans. Otters are known for their playful behavior, like sliding down riverbanks and playing with stones.

Name: Flamingo
description: Flamingos are tall, pink birds with long legs and necks. They are known for their bright pink feathers, which can actually vary in shade depending on their diet. They are wading birds, meaning they feed in shallow water, often using their unique bill to filter food from the mud or water.

Name: Emperor Penguin
description: Emperor penguins are the largest of all penguin species, standing about 4 feet tall and weighing up to 88 pounds. They are known for their striking black and white feathers, with yellow or orange markings on their heads and chests according to National Geographic Kids. These flightless birds are excellent swimmers and divers, spending most of their lives in the icy waters of Antarctica.

Name: Swan
description: Swans are large, elegant birds known for their long necks and graceful swimming. They belong to the same family as ducks and geese and are often found on or near water. Swans have webbed feet for swimming and can also fly long distances, sometimes migrating in a V-formation.

Name: Boar
description: Boars are wild pigs with a muscular body, a long snout, and sharp tusks, especially the males. They have coarse hair, often dark brown or black, and are known for their strength and ability to dig in the ground with their snouts.

Name: Mammoth
description: Mammoths were large, hairy, elephant-like creatures that lived long ago. They are known for their long, curved tusks and thick fur, which helped them survive in cold, icy environments. Mammoths are extinct relatives of modern elephants.

Name: Peacock
description: Peacocks are very beautiful birds known for their vibrant, colorful feathers, especially the males, who have a long, impressive train of feathers. These feathers are often blue and green and have eye-like patterns on them. Only the male peacocks, called peacocks, have these fancy tails, which they use to attract peahens, the female peacocks.
